content:
ReplicatorSettings ReplicatorSettings Class

In this Article

Edit

Allows a stateful replica to configure the FabricReplicator when creating it via CreateReplicator(IStateProvider, ReplicatorSettings).

Syntax

Declaration

public sealed class ReplicatorSettingsPublic NotInheritable Class ReplicatorSettings

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
    Object
  • ReplicatorSettings
    ReplicatorSettings

Inherited Members

Constructors summary

ReplicatorSettings()
ReplicatorSettings()

Initializes a new instance of the ReplicatorSettings class.

Properties summary

BatchAcknowledgementInterval
BatchAcknowledgementInterval

Gets or sets the amount of time that the replicator waits after receiving an operation before sending back an acknowledgment.

InitialCopyQueueSize
InitialCopyQueueSize

Gets or sets the initial size of the copy operation queue inside FabricReplicator, which contains copy IOperations not yet pumped and processed by the service.
InitialPrimaryReplicationQueueSize
InitialPrimaryReplicationQueueSize

Defines the initial size of the primary replication operation queue inside FabricReplicator, which contains replication IOperations.The unit here is the number of operations in the queue.
InitialReplicationQueueSize
InitialReplicationQueueSize

Gets or sets the initial size of the replication queue size.
InitialSecondaryReplicationQueueSize
InitialSecondaryReplicationQueueSize

Defines the initial size of the secondary replication operation queue inside FabricReplicator, which contains replication IOperations

MaxCopyQueueSize
MaxCopyQueueSize

Gets or sets the maximum size of the copy operation queue inside FabricReplicator, which contains copy IOperations not yet pumped and processed by the service.
MaxPrimaryReplicationQueueMemorySize
MaxPrimaryReplicationQueueMemorySize

Defines the maximum size of the primary replication operation queue inside FabricReplicator, which contains replication IOperations
MaxPrimaryReplicationQueueSize
MaxPrimaryReplicationQueueSize

Defines the maximum size of the primary replication operation queue inside FabricReplicator, which contains replication IOperations
MaxReplicationMessageSize
MaxReplicationMessageSize

Gets or sets the maximum size of a message that can be transmitted via the replicator. These include replication messages, copy messages and copy context messages. The unit of representation is bytes.
MaxReplicationQueueMemorySize
MaxReplicationQueueMemorySize

Gets or sets the maximum size for the replication queue memory.
MaxReplicationQueueSize
MaxReplicationQueueSize

Gets or sets the maximum size for the replication queue.
MaxSecondaryReplicationQueueMemorySize
MaxSecondaryReplicationQueueMemorySize

Defines the maximum size of the secondary replication operation queue inside FabricReplicator, which contains replication IOperations.
MaxSecondaryReplicationQueueSize
MaxSecondaryReplicationQueueSize

Defines the maximum size of the secondary replication operation queue inside FabricReplicator, which contains replication IOperations

PrimaryWaitForPendingQuorumsTimeout
PrimaryWaitForPendingQuorumsTimeout

Defines how long the primary replicator waits for receiving a quorum of acknowledgments for any pending replication operations before processing a reconfiguration request, that could potentially result in ‘cancelling’ the pending replication operations.
ReplicatorAddress
ReplicatorAddress

Configures the address that this replicator will use when communicating with other Replicators.
RequireServiceAck
RequireServiceAck

Prevents the optimistic acknowledgment of operations in non-persistent services by requiring that the service calls Acknowledge() before it pumps the next operation.
RetryInterval
RetryInterval

Defines how long the FabricReplicator waits after it transmits a message from the primary to the secondary for the secondary to acknowledge that it has received the message.
SecondaryClearAcknowledgedOperations
SecondaryClearAcknowledgedOperations

Typically, operations in the secondary replicator are kept in the queue to be able to catchup replicas if it is promoted to a primary. With this flag enabled, the secondary replicator releases the operation as soon as it is acknowledged by the user service.
SecurityCredentials
SecurityCredentials

Allows the service to define security credentials for securing the traffic between replicators.
UseStreamFaultsAndEndOfStreamOperationAck
UseStreamFaultsAndEndOfStreamOperationAck

This supports the Service Fabric infrastructure and is not meant to be used directly from your code.

Methods summary

LoadFrom(CodePackageActivationContext, String, String)
LoadFrom(CodePackageActivationContext, String, String)

Loads the ReplicatorSettings object from the service configuration settings file.

Constructors

  • Edit
    ReplicatorSettings()
    ReplicatorSettings()

    Initializes a new instance of the ReplicatorSettings class.

    public ReplicatorSettings()Public Sub New

Properties

  • Edit
    BatchAcknowledgementInterval
    BatchAcknowledgementInterval

    Gets or sets the amount of time that the replicator waits after receiving an operation before sending back an acknowledgment. 

    public TimeSpan? BatchAcknowledgementInterval { get; set; }Public Property BatchAcknowledgementInterval As TimeSpan?

    Property Value

    • Nullable<TimeSpan>
      Nullable(Of TimeSpan)

      The amount of time that the replicator waits after receiving an operation before sending back an acknowledgment.

    Remarks

    Other operations received and acknowledged during this time period will have their acknowledgments sent back in a single message.

    Increasing the BatchAcknowledgementInterval value decreases latency of individual replication operations but increases throughput of the replicator.

    Default value is 0.05 Seconds (50 milliseconds)

  • Edit
    InitialCopyQueueSize
    InitialCopyQueueSize

    Gets or sets the initial size of the copy operation queue inside FabricReplicator, which contains copy IOperations not yet pumped and processed by the service.

    public long ? InitialCopyQueueSize { get; set; }Public Property InitialCopyQueueSize As Long?

    Property Value

    • Nullable<Int64>
      Nullable(Of Int64)

      The initial size of the copy operation queue inside FabricReplicator, which contains copy IOperations not yet pumped and processed by the service.

    Remarks

    The default value is 64. Note that values for this parameter must be a power of 2.

  • Edit
    InitialPrimaryReplicationQueueSize
    InitialPrimaryReplicationQueueSize

    Defines the initial size of the primary replication operation queue inside FabricReplicator, which contains replication IOperations.The unit here is the number of operations in the queue.

    public long ? InitialPrimaryReplicationQueueSize { get; set; }Public Property InitialPrimaryReplicationQueueSize As Long?

    Property Value

    • Nullable<Int64>
      Nullable(Of Int64)

      The initial size of the primary replication operation queue inside FabricReplicator

    Remarks

    This setting is specific to the Replicator when the role of the service is Primary

    The default value is 64. Note that values for this parameter must be a power of 2.

  • Edit
    InitialReplicationQueueSize
    InitialReplicationQueueSize

    Gets or sets the initial size of the replication queue size.

    public long ? InitialReplicationQueueSize { get; set; }Public Property InitialReplicationQueueSize As Long?

    Property Value

    • Nullable<Int64>
      Nullable(Of Int64)

      The initial size of the replication queue size.

    Remarks

  • Edit
    InitialSecondaryReplicationQueueSize
    InitialSecondaryReplicationQueueSize

    Defines the initial size of the secondary replication operation queue inside FabricReplicator, which contains replication IOperations 

    public long ? InitialSecondaryReplicationQueueSize { get; set; }Public Property InitialSecondaryReplicationQueueSize As Long?

    Property Value

    • Nullable<Int64>
      Nullable(Of Int64)

      The initial size of the secondary replication operation queue inside FabricReplicator, which contains replication IOperations not yet pumped and processed by the service. The unit here is the number of operations in the queue

    Remarks

    This setting is specific to the Replicator when the role of the service is Secondary/Idle

    The default value is 64. Note that values for this parameter must be a power of 2.

  • Edit
    MaxCopyQueueSize
    MaxCopyQueueSize

    Gets or sets the maximum size of the copy operation queue inside FabricReplicator, which contains copy IOperations not yet pumped and processed by the service.

    public long ? MaxCopyQueueSize { get; set; }Public Property MaxCopyQueueSize As Long?

    Property Value

    • Nullable<Int64>
      Nullable(Of Int64)

      The maximum size of the copy operation queue inside FabricReplicator, which contains copy IOperations not yet pumped and processed by the service.

    Remarks

    If this queue size is reached at the secondary, operations will be buffered in the Primary’s copy queue. If that queue also fills, then the Primary will begin seeing ReplicationQueueFull exceptions.

    The default value is 1024

  • Edit
    MaxPrimaryReplicationQueueMemorySize
    MaxPrimaryReplicationQueueMemorySize

    Defines the maximum size of the primary replication operation queue inside FabricReplicator, which contains replication IOperations

    public long ? MaxPrimaryReplicationQueueMemorySize { get; set; }Public Property MaxPrimaryReplicationQueueMemorySize As Long?

    Property Value

    • Nullable<Int64>
      Nullable(Of Int64)

      . Returns the maximum size of the primary replication operation queue inside FabricReplicator, which contains replication IOperations The unit here is the virtual memory consumption of the queue .Returns Int64.

    Remarks

    This setting is specific to the Replicator when the role of the service is Primary. The default value is 0. This implies there is no memory limit

  • Edit
    MaxPrimaryReplicationQueueSize
    MaxPrimaryReplicationQueueSize

    Defines the maximum size of the primary replication operation queue inside FabricReplicator, which contains replication IOperations

    public long ? MaxPrimaryReplicationQueueSize { get; set; }Public Property MaxPrimaryReplicationQueueSize As Long?

    Property Value

    • Nullable<Int64>
      Nullable(Of Int64)

      The maximum size of the primary replication operation queue inside FabricReplicator, which contains replication IOperations. The unit here is the number of operations in the queue.

    Remarks

    If this queue size is reached, then the Primary will begin seeing ReplicationQueueFull exceptions.

    The default value is 1024 Note that values for this parameter must be a power of 2.

    This setting is specific to the Replicator when the role of the service is Primary

  • Edit
    MaxReplicationMessageSize
    MaxReplicationMessageSize

    Gets or sets the maximum size of a message that can be transmitted via the replicator. These include replication messages, copy messages and copy context messages. The unit of representation is bytes.

    public long ? MaxReplicationMessageSize { get; set; }Public Property MaxReplicationMessageSize As Long?

    Property Value

    • Nullable<Int64>
      Nullable(Of Int64)

      The maximum size of a message that can be transmitted via the replicator.

    Remarks

    The default value is 50MB

  • Edit
    MaxReplicationQueueMemorySize
    MaxReplicationQueueMemorySize

    Gets or sets the maximum size for the replication queue memory.

    public long ? MaxReplicationQueueMemorySize { get; set; }Public Property MaxReplicationQueueMemorySize As Long?

    Property Value

    • Nullable<Int64>
      Nullable(Of Int64)

      The maximum size for the replication queue memory.

    Remarks

    The default value is 0. This implies there is no memory limit

  • Edit
    MaxReplicationQueueSize
    MaxReplicationQueueSize

    Gets or sets the maximum size for the replication queue.

    public long ? MaxReplicationQueueSize { get; set; }Public Property MaxReplicationQueueSize As Long?

    Property Value

    • Nullable<Int64>
      Nullable(Of Int64)

      the maximum size for the replication queue.

    Remarks

  • Edit
    MaxSecondaryReplicationQueueMemorySize
    MaxSecondaryReplicationQueueMemorySize

    Defines the maximum size of the secondary replication operation queue inside FabricReplicator, which contains replication IOperations.

    public long ? MaxSecondaryReplicationQueueMemorySize { get; set; }Public Property MaxSecondaryReplicationQueueMemorySize As Long?

    Property Value

    • Nullable<Int64>
      Nullable(Of Int64)

      Returns the maximum size of the secondary replication operation queue inside FabricReplicator, which contains replication IOperations. The unit here is the virtual memory consumption of the queue.

    Remarks

    This setting is specific to the Replicator when the role of the service is Secondary/Idle. The default value is 0. This implies there is no memory limit

  • Edit
    MaxSecondaryReplicationQueueSize
    MaxSecondaryReplicationQueueSize

    Defines the maximum size of the secondary replication operation queue inside FabricReplicator, which contains replication IOperations 

    public long ? MaxSecondaryReplicationQueueSize { get; set; }Public Property MaxSecondaryReplicationQueueSize As Long?

    Property Value

    • Nullable<Int64>
      Nullable(Of Int64)

      The maximum size of the secondary replication operation queue inside FabricReplicator, which contains replication IOperations not yet pumped and processed by the service. The unit here is the number of operations in the queue

    Remarks

    If this queue size is reached, operations will be buffered in the Primary’s replication queue. If that queue also fills, then the Primary will begin seeing ReplicationQueueFull exceptions.

    The default value is 2048.Note that values for this parameter must be a power of 2.

    This setting is specific to the Replicator when the role of the service is Secondary/Idle

  • Edit
    PrimaryWaitForPendingQuorumsTimeout
    PrimaryWaitForPendingQuorumsTimeout

    Defines how long the primary replicator waits for receiving a quorum of acknowledgments for any pending replication operations before processing a reconfiguration request, that could potentially result in ‘cancelling’ the pending replication operations.

    public TimeSpan? PrimaryWaitForPendingQuorumsTimeout { get; set; }Public Property PrimaryWaitForPendingQuorumsTimeout As TimeSpan?

    Property Value

    • Nullable<TimeSpan>
      Nullable(Of TimeSpan)

      Amount of time the primary replicator waits for receiving a quorum of acknowledgments for any pending replication operations when there is a request for the primary replicator to process a reconfiguration TimeSpan.

    Remarks

    The default value is 0. This implies that reconfigurations aren’t waited upon for receiving quorum on the pending replication operations. This helps in completing reconfigurations sooner. Note that larger values for this parameter could potentially result in slower reconfigurations, implying longer durations to fail-over a primary.

  • Edit
    ReplicatorAddress
    ReplicatorAddress

    Configures the address that this replicator will use when communicating with other Replicators.

    public string ReplicatorAddress { get; set; }Public Property ReplicatorAddress As String

    Property Value

    • String
      String

      The address that this replicator will use when communicating with other Replicators.

    Remarks

    String is formatted as “hostname:port”, where hostname can be FQDN or IP address. The default value is localhost:0

  • Edit
    RequireServiceAck
    RequireServiceAck

    Prevents the optimistic acknowledgment of operations in non-persistent services by requiring that the service calls Acknowledge() before it pumps the next operation.

    public bool ? RequireServiceAck { get; set; }Public Property RequireServiceAck As Boolean?

    Property Value

    • Nullable<Boolean>
      Nullable(Of Boolean)

      true if the optimistic acknowledgment of operations in non-persistent services;otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    Non-persistent services which require explicit acknowledgment can set this property to True in order to prevent optimistic acknowledgment of the operations by the Replicator. This setting has no effect for persistent services.

    The default value is false.

  • Edit
    RetryInterval
    RetryInterval

    Defines how long the FabricReplicator waits after it transmits a message from the primary to the secondary for the secondary to acknowledge that it has received the message.

    public TimeSpan? RetryInterval { get; set; }Public Property RetryInterval As TimeSpan?

    Property Value

    • Nullable<TimeSpan>
      Nullable(Of TimeSpan)

      The time needed the FabricReplicator waits after it transmits a message from the primary to the secondary for the secondary to acknowledge that it has received the message.

    Remarks

    Receiving a message does not necessarily that the message has been processed.

    If this timer is exceeded, then the message is retransmitted.

    The default value is 5 seconds.

  • Edit
    SecondaryClearAcknowledgedOperations
    SecondaryClearAcknowledgedOperations

    Typically, operations in the secondary replicator are kept in the queue to be able to catchup replicas if it is promoted to a primary. With this flag enabled, the secondary replicator releases the operation as soon as it is acknowledged by the user service.

    public bool ? SecondaryClearAcknowledgedOperations { get; set; }Public Property SecondaryClearAcknowledgedOperations As Boolean?

    Property Value

    • Nullable<Boolean>
      Nullable(Of Boolean)

      true if the secondary replicator releases the operation as soon as it is acknowledged by the user service; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    The default value is false

  • Edit
    SecurityCredentials
    SecurityCredentials

    Allows the service to define security credentials for securing the traffic between replicators.

    public SecurityCredentials SecurityCredentials { get; set; }Public Property SecurityCredentials As SecurityCredentials

    Property Value

    • SecurityCredentials
      SecurityCredentials

      The service to define security credentials for securing the traffic between replicators.

  • Edit
    UseStreamFaultsAndEndOfStreamOperationAck
    UseStreamFaultsAndEndOfStreamOperationAck

    This supports the Service Fabric infrastructure and is not meant to be used directly from your code.

    public bool ? UseStreamFaultsAndEndOfStreamOperationAck { get; set; }Public Property UseStreamFaultsAndEndOfStreamOperationAck As Boolean?

    Property Value

    • Nullable<Boolean>
      Nullable(Of Boolean)

Methods

  • Edit
    LoadFrom(CodePackageActivationContext, String, String)
    LoadFrom(CodePackageActivationContext, String, String)

    Loads the ReplicatorSettings object from the service configuration settings file.

    public static ReplicatorSettings LoadFrom(CodePackageActivationContext codePackageActivationContext, string configPackageName, string sectionName)Public Shared Function LoadFrom(codePackageActivationContext As CodePackageActivationContext, configPackageName As String, sectionName As String) As ReplicatorSettings

    Parameters

    • codePackageActivationContext
      CodePackageActivationContext
      CodePackageActivationContext

      The current code package activation context CodePackageActivationContext

    • configPackageName
      String
      String

      The current configuration package name

    • sectionName
      String
      String

      The section within the configuration file that defines all the replicator settings

    Returns

    • ReplicatorSettings
      ReplicatorSettings

      The loaded ReplicatorSettings object from the service configuration settings file

    Remarks

    The configuration settings file (settings.xml) within the service configuration folder generally contains all the replicator settings that is needed to pass in the ReplicatorSettings object to the CreateReplicator(IStateProvider, ReplicatorSettings) method. Typically, the onus is on the service author to read the settings.xml file, parse the values and appropriately construct the ReplicatorSettings object.

    With the current helper method, the service author can bypass the above process.

    The following are the parameter names that should be provided in the service configuration “settings.xml”, to be recognizable by windows fabric to perform the above parsing automatically:

    1. BatchAcknowledgementInterval –BatchAcknowledgementInterval value in seconds

    2. InitialCopyQueueSize -InitialCopyQueueSize

    3. MaxCopyQueueSize -MaxCopyQueueSize

    4. MaxReplicationMessageSize -MaxReplicationMessageSize

    5. RetryInterval -RetryInterval value in seconds

    6. RequireServiceAck -RequireServiceAck

    7. ReplicatorAddress or ReplicatorEndpoint – ReplicatorAddress should be of the form IPort. ReplicatorEndpoint must reference a valid service endpoint resource from the service manifest -ReplicatorAddress

    8. SecondaryClearAcknowledgedOperations -SecondaryClearAcknowledgedOperations

    9. PrimaryWaitForPendingQuorumsTimeout - PrimaryWaitForPendingQuorumsTimeout value in seconds

    10. UseStreamFaultsAndEndOfStreamOperationAck -UseStreamFaultsAndEndOfStreamOperationAck

    11. InitialPrimaryReplicationQueueSize -InitialPrimaryReplicationQueueSize

    12. InitialSecondaryReplicationQueueSize -InitialSecondaryReplicationQueueSize

    13. MaxPrimaryReplicationQueueSize -MaxPrimaryReplicationQueueSize

    14. MaxSecondaryReplicationQueueSize -MaxSecondaryReplicationQueueSize

    15. MaxPrimaryReplicationQueueMemorySize -MaxPrimaryReplicationQueueMemorySize

    16. MaxSecondaryReplicationQueueMemorySize -MaxSecondaryReplicationQueueMemorySize

Details

Namespace

System.Fabric

Assembly

System.Fabric.dll
